patient_info: Diplopia,Bilateral ptosis,Dysphagia,Leukoencephalopathy,Difficulty walking,Abnormal cerebral white matter morphology,Varicose veins,Atherosclerosis,Easy fatigability,EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation,Exercise intolerance,Abnormal carotid artery morphology,Unilateral ptosis,EMG: repetitive nerve stimulation abnormality,Anti-acetylcholine receptor antibody positivity
golden_diagnosis: 全身型重症肌无力/Generalized myasthenia gravis; GMG/Myasthenia gravis/Myasthenia gravis,全身型重症肌无力/Generalized myasthenia gravis; GMG/Myasthenia gravis/Myasthenia gravis,全身型重症肌无力/Generalized myasthenia gravis; GMG/Myasthenia gravis/Myasthenia gravis
predict_diagnosis:
1. Myasthenia gravis, generalized (GMG)
2. Neuromyelitis optica (NMO) spectrum disorder
3. Multiple sclerosis (MS)
4. Inflammatory muscle disease (IMD), such as polymyositis or dermatomyositis
5. Peripheral neuropathy
6. Motor neuron disease (MND), such as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) or primary lateral sclerosis (PLS)
7. Brain tumor or lesion causing compression or infringement on cranial nerves
8. Idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH) or pseudotumor cerebri
9. Stroke or vascular disease affecting brain function
10. Metabolic or toxic disorder affecting muscle function, such as mitochondrial disease or muscular dystrophy

Please note that this list is not exhaustive, and other rare or less likely diagnoses could also be considered based on the patient's clinical presentation and further evaluation. It is essential to perform thorough clinical assessments, laboratory tests, and imaging studies to establish the most accurate diagnosis.
